newsitem.title: FRANCE: French capital markets closing report.
newsitem.headline: French capital markets closing report.

text.p: Ten-year bond futures settled in negative territory in thin trade with the market weighed down by fears of possible U.S. rate tightening following Friday's strong durable goods orders.
"People are starting to worry about whether monetary tightening could be in the pipeline in the United States," said one analyst.

In the absence of any major domestic or European news, the United States was driving the French market. Analysts said the outlook for the notionnel contract and the three-month PIBOR was bearish with a tendency for investors to sell on the upticks.

The market was undermined by the weak performance of the U.S. T-Bond and vulnerable to movements of the franc which continued soft on dollar weakness and concerns about the French budget due next month, analysts said.
Analysts said that in wake of the German rate cut last week, the market had no more good news to look forward to.
"There's a feeling that the Bundesbank has given its all and now the focus is shifting to fundamentals," one said.
"It's up to the French government to show the market what it can do," he said.
